technology.short_description: They are gifts to be treasured until they burst.

effects.description: HIDDEN - NEED FOR SCOPING TO FORCES AS WELL AS REGIONS - Infections: +15 when plague is spread to owned regions and forces
Infections: +15 when Plague is spread to owned settlements and armies
Adds an additional Blessed Symptom when generating plagues (when Symptom Locations are next randomised)

technology.short_description: Like a fly laying its eggs, keep warm… incubate.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord and Hero recruit rank: +2
Hero capacity: +1 for all Heroes

technology.short_description: From life follows death, from death follows decay, from decay follows new life. The great wheel forever turns – and judicious contagions can speed its passage.

effects.description: Daemons Reforged: +5% chance for destroyed Daemons of Nurgle units to be restored after battle
Winds of Magic cost: -10% for Lores of Nurgle and Death spells
Cooldown: -20% to Lores of Nurgle and Death spells

ui_effects.localised_text: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

technology.short_description: Though Nurgle's ocular pox lays rapid waste to mortal settlements, amongst the Urfather's chosen it is a virulent spur to great deeds.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Infrastructure buildings
Nurgle corruption in adjacent provinces: +1

technology.short_description: As the Rot carries far and wide, the noxious fruit of Nurgle's distant garden ripen and swell. The more virulent the spread, the more seeds the mouldering fruit shall bear.

effects.description: Population surplus: +1 for newly-captured settlements
Chance of a plague spreading: +5% (for all future plagues)

technology.short_description: Nurgle's Black Plague is only a death sentence for the faithless. For the Urfather's true believers, the ravening passage of His great contagion leaves armour-hard scabs in its wake.

effects.description: Rush Cycle cost: -10%
Cycle time: -1 for Advanced Military buildings

technology.short_description: Monuments to the conquest of disease spring up out of the ground in areas stricken with malady, further swelling the ranks of the Urfather's vile armies.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Military Recruitment buildings
Daemons Reforged: +5% chance for destroyed Daemons of Nurgle units to be restored after battle
Recruitment health: +5% for all units

technology.short_description: The touch of Nurgle is a wondrous gift indeed, sapping strength from muscle and sloughing skin from bone.

effects.description: Bound spell: "Curse of the Leper" for Great Unclean One units
Bound spell: "Fleshy Abundance" for Great Unclean One units

technology.short_description: When the Black Death bites deep, countless souls shall perish in flesh-cracked, fever-wracked agony. In these joyous times, a champion shall stand tall.

effects.description:
Hit points: +5%
	(all characters factionwide)
Battle healing cap: +10%
Number of uses: +1 for bound spells on Great Unclean One units

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

technology.short_description: Once the stream of pus passes a certain threshold, even Maggotkin cannot help but wipe their eyes to clear their vision.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Plague Ogres, Spawn of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
Ward save: 5% for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Plague Ogres, Spawn of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units

technology.short_description: The decomposing mulch of Nurgle's garden breeds countless foul-smelling, ruinous fungi, which yield a rich bounty of noxious spores.

effects.description: Gain +50 Treasury each time a building cycle completes
Income from Infastructure buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: The Urfather loves each and every Nurgling dearly, be they long-lived shepherds of his Rot or fated to a brief and messy existence as contagion-spreading catapult ammunition.

effects.description: Infections from all buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: Nurgle's glorious Eye Rot is traditionally gifted through airborne sweat particles, but for cooler climes the pox can adapt to live on door handles, clothing and children's toys.

effects.description: Defensive supplies: +1000
Attrition: -20% when under siege

technology.short_description: Embracing the foul putridity of Nurgle paves the winding path towards dark and unnatural powers.

effects.description: Ability: "Greater Gate of Nurgle" for Cultists in garrisons

ui_effects.localised_text: Summoned units have specific debuffs conditions

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for all Heroes

technology.short_description: The disease starts from within, silently rotting organs to mulch. Only then, as its blessed hosts stagger and vomit copious blood, does their skin begin to blacken and split.

effects.description: Bound spell: "Blight Boil" for Great Unclean One units

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Bound spell: "Rancid Visitations" for Great Unclean One units

technology.short_description: Never send to know for whom the Tallymen of Plagues drone: they drone for thee.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Plague Ogres, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
Melee defence: +4 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Plague Ogres, Spawn of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units

technology.short_description: The lands of Nurgle are coated in pus-filled protrusions. Many simply explode in a noxious shower of filth, but from the most bulbous are birthed fresh legions.

effects.description: HIDDEN - NEED FOR SCOPING TO FORCES AS WELL AS REGIONS Treasury: +150 when plague is spread to owned regions and forces
HIDDEN - NEED FOR SCOPING TO FORCES AS WELL AS REGIONS Summonable units: 1 Nurgling units when plague is spread to owned regions and forces
Summonable units: 1 Nurgling units when Plague is spread to owned settlements and armies
Treasury: +150 when Plague is spread to owned settlements and armies

technology.short_description: Disease, destruction and decay – these are what the perfectly-virulent breeding-ground requires.

effects.description: Daemons Reforged: +5% hit points for destroyed Daemons of Nurgle units restored after battle
Recruitment cost: -10%
Recruitment health: +5% for all units

technology.short_description: Death is necessary, Nurgle's greatest gift to us all, for the decay that follows is the herald of new life – squirming, oozing, reeking, slobbering new life.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Plague Ogres, Spawn of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
Melee attack: +4 for Great Unclean One, Chaos Warshrine of Nurgle, Beast of Nurgle, Plague Ogres, Spawn of Nurgle, Bile Trolls, Toad Dragon and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units

technology.short_description: The Urfather's wondrous Rot is already remarkably virulent, but as nature takes its course, new and ever-more contagious strains will emerge.

effects.description: HIDDEN - (USED WHEN WE NEED TO SCOPE TO SETTLEMENTS AND FORCES WITHOUT SHOWING BOTH EFFECTS IN UI) Infection cost to create a Plague: -10%
Chance of a plague spreading: +5% (for all future plagues)
Infection cost to create a Plague: -10%

technology.short_description: Whispers in the forest; murmurs from the shadowy valleys; secrets muttered by brooks and streams; rasping madness from the crops. The Grey Fever stalks…

effects.description: Plague immunity duration: -1 turns (for all future plagues)
Plague duration: +1 turns (for all future plagues)

technology.short_description: A well-placed pox-maggot in the eyeball can grant sight beyond sight – at least until all the jelly is consumed.

effects.description: Grants line of sight when a plague is spread

technology.short_description: Like an infected udder, this tumour squirts out Nurgling after Nurgling into the world.

effects.description: Cycle time: -1 for Basic Military buildings
Recruit rank: +1

technology.short_description: The malevolent magic of the Urfather burns with decay, flowing through the mortal realm and rotting all it touches.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +3 per turn
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15

technology.short_description: On the day the Black Death came, consuming the flesh of untold thousands, decimating the Empire of man, none could deny Nurgle's foetid majesty. Lo, that day shall come again…

effects.description: Upkeep: -7%
Military buildings enemy debuffs are stronger

technology.short_description: Close contact is but one vector by which Nurgle's ruinous gifts may be shared. Once a strain mutates sufficiently, it can be equally contagious when hurled through the skies at speed.

effects.description: Plague God's Pasture commandment: additional +5% chance of plague spreading
Foster Cults commandment: additional +5 Infections per turn

technology.short_description: The more minds that fall to the glorious delirium of Grey Fever, and the more voices that gibber in senseless madness, the more fertile Nurgle's cankerous domain becomes.

effects.description: Plague God's Greenhouse commandment: additional -5% Rush Cycle Cost
Plague God's Nursery commandment: additional +20 Growth

technology.short_description: The time of Rot has come! Father Nurgle grants unto us his greatest gift! Let the world entire be remade in His festering image!

effects.description: Army ability: "Fecundity"

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to friends within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

technology.short_description: "Buboes, phlegm, blood and guts! Boils, bogeys, Rot and pus! Blisters, fevers, weeping sores! From your wounds the fester pours."

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
Daemons Reforged: +5% hit points for destroyed Daemons of Nurgle units restored after battle

technology.short_description: Blisters burst, sores weep, lesions bleed, spores choke, flies bite. Let the fester pour forth!

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Infantry units
Speed: +10% for Infantry units

technology.short_description: There are no words that could accurately describe the sickly substance which seeps from the pores of a Red Ague host, but Nurgle himself fondly calls it 'crimson honey'.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Cavalry, Chariots, and Warbeasts units
Charge bonus: +10 for Cavalry, Chariots, and Warbeasts units

technology.short_description: To those mortals who have wisely given themselves to the worship of the Ruinous Powers, Grandfather Nurgle shall provide a richly festering, gloriously agonising reward.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +25 with Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Beastmen and Norsca

technology.short_description: The petty games, intrigues, temptations and tantrums of the other Ruinous Powers drive the usually blithesome Nurgle into an uncharacteristic fury!

effects.description: Leadership: +7 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Beastmen
Melee attack: +7 when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Beastmen
Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Beastmen

technology.short_description: Colder lands are no barrier to the Urfather's flesh-ravaging affections. His scarlet pestilence shall be a benediction upon all, come rain or shine.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for all non-Daemonic Infantry units
Weapon strength: +10% for non-Daemonic Infantry units

technology.short_description: Though Nurgle's Rot is disease perfected, already His ultimate gift to existence, there remains scope for delightfully nauseating new augmentations.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10%
	(all characters factionwide)
Unit experience gain: +10%
Cooldown: -10% to "Touch of the Plague"

technology.short_description: From the Fly Master's oozing innards arises a swarm of filth-caked insects, shrouding Nurgle's children within a buzzing, pustulant cloud.

effects.description: Speed: +20% for Nurglings units
Unit mass: +20% for Daemonic Infantry units
Missile resistance: 10% for Plaguebearers of Nurgle and Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle units

technology.short_description: By soaking a Fury's claws in flesh-burning contagions, even the slightest scratch will bless its prey with the fabulous gift of death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for flying units
Missile resistance: 10% for flying units

technology.short_description: Flesh gruesomely caked in cankers, tumours, cysts and scars: there is no greater armour in this or any other realm.

effects.description:
Ward save: 5%
	(all characters factionwide)
Vigour loss reduction: -10%
Cooldown: -10% to "Chosen of Nurgle"

technology.short_description: Most Rot-eater spawn are idly popped and drunk by passing Plaguebearers, but the fastest and hungriest survive to become wondrous nightmares.

effects.description: Unit mass: +20% for Cavalry, Chariots and non-flying Warbeast units
Charge bonus: +20% for Cavalry, Chariots and non-flying Warbeast units

technology.short_description: No two Maggotkin look identical, for each has their own array of weeping sores and cracked lesions, but all are born from the blighted carcasses of mortals.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5% for armies
Income from military buildings: +10%

technology.short_description: Flesh is but one of Nurgle's churches. His sermons may also be preached within the mind, where pathogens strip all reason from their hosts. As madness reigns, the Urfather rejoices.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for non-Daemonic Infantry units
Melee defence: +4 for non-Daemonic Infantry units

technology.short_description: Though sending lone Nurglings toward enemy settlements appears a baffling act of folly, the tiny Daemons know no greater honour than to die showering their killers in disease.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Daemonic Infantry units
Physical resistance: 5% for Daemonic Infantry units

technology.short_description: Each new pustule and tumour is a blessed mark of the Urfather's love. With every retch and heave summoned by the sight of such growths, Nurgle is shown deserved gratitude.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Cavalry, Chariots and Warbeasts units
Melee attack: +4 for Cavalry, Chariots, and Warbeasts units

technology.short_description: When the armies of sickness raise their foetid banners, they leave nothing but festering corpses in their wake.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 for Cavalry, Chariots, and Warbeasts units
Melee defence: +4 for Cavalry, Chariots, and Warbeasts units

technology.short_description: When the flesh can bear no more lesions, the spirit seeks release. So endless is Nurgle's love that he does not permit this misguided folly – there are always more gifts to bestow.

effects.description: Casualties captured post-battle: +10%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +10%

technology.short_description: By soaking a Fury's claws in flesh-burning contagions, even the slightest scratch will bless its prey with the fabulous gift of death.

effects.description: Nurgle corruption: +1

technology.short_description: Each new pustule and tumour is a blessed mark of the Urfather's love. With every retch and heave summoned by the sight of such growths, Nurgle is shown deserved gratitude.

effects.description:
Growth per region: +5 after winning a battle
	(all provinces)
Growth: +10

technology.short_description: Sometimes, misguided hosts-to-be attempt to refuse Nurgle's pestilent bounty. Once the Grey Fever consumes their minds they shall see the truth, and welcome Him into their hearts.

effects.description: Campaign line of sight: +15% for settlements
Control: +1

technology.short_description: Some diseases are not apparent until long after they have been shared with others through acts of congress. There is, after all, no gift as kindly meant as one imparted in secret.

effects.description:
Army ability: "Summoned from Beyond"
	(faction leader's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Summoned units have specific debuffs conditions

technology.short_description: Legend tells that a single tear from a Tainted One's saprogenic eyeball can blind an entire city in weeks. The legends are wrong. This heroic feat requires mere days.

effects.description: Army ability: "Rot, Glorious Rot"

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit
